bibl.note: This is a letter dated August 12, 1805 from John Sevier of Tennessee to Colonel Jonathan Meigs at the Department of War. Sevier's brief letter to Meigs informs of an enclosed letter by Colonel Scott describing a massacre involving Cherokee Indians.

div.p: You will receive enclosed the copy of a letter from Colonel Scott of Blount County to the executive, and my letter addressed the warriors and chiefs of the cherokee nation on that subject

You will perceive by Mr Mister Scotts letter that some of the Cherokees have committed a very daring insult, massacar massacre can not be passed over in silence- You will have the goodness to cause my letter to be laid before the chief so soon as may be conveinant convenient , in order that their answer may be obtained as speedily as possible.
